decks.notes: The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and auras, focusing on enchanting creatures like Witchstalker and Gladecover Scout with cards like Unflinching Courage and Madcap Skills to deal massive damage. The deck also includes support cards like Selesnya Charm and Boros Charm to deal with threats and protect its own creatures. The mana base is designed to support a variety of colors to ensure consistency in casting spells. Ajani, Caller of the Pride provides additional support and threats, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure to the opponent using a combination of low-cost creatures with abilities that allow for early aggression. The inclusion of powerful cards like Master of Waves and Thassa, God of the Sea provide additional synergy and potential for strong tempo plays. The deck also features disruption elements like Judge's Familiar and Tidebinder Mage to control the opponent's board while pushing damage. Overall, the Mono Blue Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient strategy.

This deck focuses on overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures that have high devotion to black, allowing for powerful effects from cards like Gray Merchant of Asphodel. Mutavaults provide additional creatures and Underworld Connections helps maintain card advantage. Removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Thoughtseize help control the opponent's board while Desecration Demon and Pack Rat apply pressure. Lifebane Zombie can disrupt opponents' strategies while Bile Blight and Ultimate Price help deal with problematic threats. Overall, the deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total through a combination of creatures and removal spells.

The deck focuses on using black devotion cards to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Pack Rat and Desecration Demon, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall. The deck also includes lifegain and card draw from cards like Gray Merchant of Asphodel and Underworld Connections, adding resilience to the aggressive strategy. The mana base is primarily comprised of swamps and temples to ensure consistent and efficient casting of spells.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive black creature cards while also disrupting their game plan with discard spells and removal. By maximizing the devotion to black in the mana base and creature cards, it aims to consistently deal damage through efficient threats like Pack Rat, Nightveil Specter, Gray Merchant of Asphodel, and Desecration Demon. The inclusion of card draw and removal spells provides both card advantage and answers to opposing threats, allowing the deck to maintain pressure and control the game.

The main idea of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to quickly flood the battlefield with low-cost creatures like Cloudfin Raptor and Frostburn Weird, while using cards like Thassa, God of the Sea and Master of Waves to buff up your board and push damage through. Judge's Familiar and Tidebinder Mage are included to disrupt your opponent's game plan, while Bident of Thassa provides card draw and Hall of Triumph boosts the stats of all your creatures. Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx can help provide additional mana for powerful plays, with Rapid Hybridization and Cyclonic Rift providing removal options when needed.

The main idea of this Aggro Abzan deck is to utilize powerful creatures like Blood Baron of Vizkopa and Voice of Resurgence to quickly overwhelm the opponent while also having access to removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Ultimate Price to deal with threats. The inclusion of cards like Courser of Kruphix and Ajani, Mentor of Heroes provide additional value and card advantage, allowing for a strong and resilient board presence. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with low-cost creatures and disruption spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. It relies on efficient removal like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall to clear the way for early creatures like Tormented Hero and Gnarled Scarhide. Mutavault also serves as an additional threat and mana source. The goal is to quickly build a threatening board presence with cards like Spiteful Returned and Herald of Torment, supported by the tribal synergy of Mogis's Marauder and Lifebane Zombie.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through card advantage, counter spells, and board wipes in order to stabilize and win in the late game. It is centered around utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace and Elspeth, along with card draw spells like Sphinx's Revelation to generate card advantage. It also includes a mix of counterspells, removal, and board wipes to control the board and prevent the opponent from gaining momentum. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and outlast them in a war of attrition until it can secure a win condition.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Sylvan Caryatid and Elvish Mystic to play powerful creatures like Stormbreath Dragon and Polukranos, World Eater. Domri Rade and Xenagos, the Reveler provide additional support and card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Sire of Insanity and Rakdos's Return disrupt the opponent's hand and board state, while Ghor-Clan Rampager and Mizzium Mortars help in pushing through damage and clearing threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and big creatures.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to maintain early aggression and tempo through efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures like Young Pyromancer and Chandra's Phoenix. The deck utilizes powerful removal spells like Warleader's Helix and Chained to the Rocks to control the board while pushing damage through with direct damage spells like Shock, Lightning Strike, and Boros Charm. The deck also includes a few scry lands to filter through the deck for better draws and land consistency. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of burn and creature aggression.

The primary strategy of this deck is to control the game by using powerful planeswalkers like Kiora, Jace, and Elspeth, alongside efficient removal spells like Supreme Verdict, Detention Sphere, and Banishing Light. The deck aims to stall the opponent's board development with cards like Courser of Kruphix and Sylvan Caryatid, while generating card advantage and life gain with cards like Sphinx's Revelation. The deck also plays efficient threats like Aetherling and Advent of the Wurm to close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently controlled.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play high devotion to black creatures and use disruptive spells to control the opponent's hand and board state. Utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall to disrupt the opponent's strategy while ramping up devotion with creatures like Pack Rat, Gray Merchant of Asphodel, and Desecration Demon. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Mizzium Mortars and Dreadbore to maintain board control and close out the game with powerful finishers. The synergy between devotion to black creatures and disruptive spells makes this deck a formidable force in the 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish board control through aggressive plays while also utilizing black mana devotion to power up key cards like Gray Merchant of Asphodel. With a mix of disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Hero's Downfall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up a strong board presence with cards like Pack Rat and Desecration Demon. By efficiently using the resources provided by cards like Underworld Connections and Mutavault, the deck can overwhelm the opponent and secure a fast victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence and utilize the devotion to black mechanic. By disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Lifebane Zombie, while controlling the board with removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Bile Blight, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats like Pack Rat, Desecration Demon, and Gray Merchant of Asphodel. The inclusion of cards like Whip of Erebos and Underworld Connections provide additional utility and card advantage to help maintain pressure on the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to play powerful creatures like Polukranos, World Eater and Stormbreath Dragon early on with the help of ramp cards like Elvish Mystic and Sylvan Caryatid. Xenagos, the Reveler and Domri Rade provide additional creature support and card advantage, while Ghor-Clan Rampager and Boon Satyr offer versatility and aggression. Courser of Kruphix helps with card selection and life gain, making the deck resilient against control matchups. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and win through aggressive combat damage.
